duties_responsibilities.duty: Assist Senior Retirement Plan Consultants in responding to advisors needs on all types of retirement plans.
Maintain up-to date knowledge of present legislation and proposed legislative changes affecting ERISA and non-ERISA plans.
Respond to requests for proposals issued by school districts and governmental units seeking providers for 403(b) and 457(b) plans.
Managing Industry Organizations (e.g. FSI, NTSA) advisor memberships and coordinating with commissions for advisor renewals.
Reviewing QDROs and assist in the sale of ERISA plans.
Assist with the implementation and design of procedures supporting Department of Labor requirements on Plan disclosures such as 408(b)(2) and 404(a)(5) disclosures.
Provide assistance with retirement plan consulting services to external or internal clients regarding basic to advanced retirement plan questions and scenarios.
Act as a back-up to the RPCs in maintaining relationships with key contacts at state agencies, NTSA, and selected data aggregators and software providers.

education_certification.credential: Certified Pension Consultant, Qualified Plan Financial Consultant, Qualified Pension Administrator, Chartered Retirement Planning Counselor or other designation to be completed within 1 year.
